Internal environment 50/100
Prevention of legionella Unknown
Prescence of asbestos No
Risk on asbestos No, the building is building is built after 1994
Method of measuring asbestos in building Not applicable
External environment 40/100
Air quality index 4
Noise disturbance Between 55 and 60
Scent pollution Unknown
Soil pollution Research conducted, further investigation may be necessary
Building comfort 75/100
Ventilation strategy Mechanical input and output
Tempature control Users can open windows and can control radiators
Ventilation control Users can control ventilation around their workplace
Lighting control Users can influence lighting around their workplace
Access to daylight Every office space has daylight - directly or indirectly
Percentage of glass façade More than 20%
Health features 90/100
Prevention of light pollution All windows have systems that prevent light pollution, that can be controlled by its users
Presence of relaxation areas Relaxation areas are present
Number of offices with an outside view (in %) More than 75% of office spaces have an outside view
Type of fluorescent lighting All fluorescent lighting has high frequency control gear
Health 56/100

Owners have buldings have certain repsonsibilities with respect to the health of its users ('Internal environment'). In addition, users increasingly expect and demand a certain extend of comfort ('Building comfort' and 'External environment') and features ('Health features') that enable them to work in a healthly and comfortable environment. Moreover, research has shown that this is beneficial for the overall effectiveness en efficiency of its users in terms of productivity.
